clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Heating Transfusion on Brain Function
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Heating Transfusion on Brain Function of Surgical Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

clinical_study.source: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: To inversitage whether routine warming of blood is harmful to brain fuction of sugical patients receiving massive transfusion.

detailed_description.textblock: Hypothermia is an effective therapeutic intervention to reduce hypoxic ischemia brain injury in animal experiments and in clinics.In a recent study, it has been shown that perioperative warming was associated with a higher incidence of cognitive dysfunction in elderly patients.Therefore, we hypothesised that perioperative heating transfusion have a side effect on brain function of surgical patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at post-transfusion 15min, 30min, 1hour, 2hour, 3 hour, 6hour, 12hour, 24hour
primary_outcome.description: Brain function includes cerebral blood flow and cerebral oxygen saturation

secondary_outcome.measure: the cognitive performance and the score of postoperative quality recovery scales ( PQRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Chang from baseline at 15min,40min,1day,3day and 7day postoperative lay

other_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline at 3hour, 6hour, 12hour, 24hour after transfusion

study_pop.textblock: adult paitents scheduled for major surgery.
